channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Legal Fight Over DOGE Cuts Just Landed Elon Musk in the Hot Seat
item.description: Musk’s legal team failed to get him out of court. Now, he must face questioning about DOGE and USAID.

item.title: Costco Just Expanded One of Its Most Underrated Membership Perks
item.description: The warehouse has quietly improved the membership value over the past year.

item.title: The tech industry is spending millions to fix data centers’ image problem
item.description: With community opposition growing, data center backers are going on a full-scale public relations blitz. Around Christmas in Virginia, which boasts th...

item.title: E.l.f.’s $1 Billion Bet on Hailey Bieber’s Rhode Is Paying Off—Faster Than Expected
item.description: “There’s tremendous pent-up demand for Rhode,” CEO Tarang Amin said in an earnings call yesterday.

item.title: Visa launches a new platform aimed at helping small businesses access capital and gain exposure
item.description: Visa announced on Thursday a new platform designed to stimulate small businesses through a variety of tools and network opportunities. The program, Vi...

item.title: Top analyst Tom Lee on gold’s black swan risk: Elon Musk becoming ‘the new central bank’
item.description: "It all fits in a swimming pool, all the gold in the world," the Fundstrat head of research said. Plus, it's "extraterrestrial."

item.title: Rocket CEO says U.S. mortgage industry is a ‘tale of two cities.’ His booming business shows a broader reality for American homebuyers
item.description: “Mortgage rates dropped to the lowest that they've been in the past three years,” Varun Krishna said, “and Rocket was right there to capitalize.”

item.title: Anthropic’s new Claude Opus 4.6 aims to think through bigger codebases
item.description: Anthropic is out with a new model called Claude Opus 4.6 , an upgrade to its top-of-the-line Opus 4.5 model that launched in November. The new release...

item.title: Why one Anthropic update wiped billions off software stocks
item.description: Tech workers have been worried for years now about the AI tidal wave coming for their jobs, but their bosses are starting to worry too. Stocks plunged...

item.title: Kalshi Rolls Out Insider Trading Rules Ahead of Super Bowl
item.description: The announcement comes after multiple state gaming commissions pursue legal action against the predictions market.

item.title: Nestlé’s CEO drinks 8 coffees a day, but says Gen Z staffers are his secret to staying sharp by ‘learning constantly’
item.description: In his company turnaround effort, Nestlé CEO Philipp Navratil is drinking twice as much coffee as the average American to stay fueled—while admitting ...

item.title: OpenAI’s new model leaps ahead in coding capabilities—but raises unprecedented cybersecurity risks
item.description: Why OpenAI’s latest coding breakthrough is forcing the company to rethink how—and how fast—it can deploy its most powerful models

item.title: Gen Z are rebelling against TikTok USA by installing another app—founded by an Oracle alum
item.description: TikTok USA isn't just (arguably) a tool of corporate power, it doesn't seem to work as well as the old TikTok.

item.title: Nike is being investigated for anti-white discrimination. It could upend corporate DEI.

item.title: A Breakdown of This Olympian’s $23 Million Income Proves There’s More Money Off the Slopes
item.description: Eileen Gu is excelling as a model and influencer, too.
